Name: Instrument Used in the "Mouth Opening" ritual
Description: This instrument was used to touch some parts of the body of the deceased, or his statue, in order to give him symbolic life after death, so that he might eat and speak.This ritual was called the "Opening of the Mouth" and would be performed by priests in a number of places, from the burial chamber to the workshops of the embalmers or the sculptors.New Kingdom papyri frequently depict scenes from the ceremony, showing the coffin standing upright in front of the priest.
